intro: Chaptalia leucocephala, commonly known as white-headed chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its most distinctive feature is the white, fluffy appearance of its flower heads, which resemble small clouds. Chaptalia leucocephala is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
